item.name: Studded Leather Armor
item.description: Reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes. AC 12+DEX

item.name: Chain Shirt Armor
item.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. AC 13+DEX (Max 2)

item.name: Scale Mail Armor
item.description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. Disadvantage on Stealth checks. AC 14+DEX (Max 2)

item.name: Breastplate Armor
item.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. AC 14+DEX (Max 2)

item.name: Half Plate Armor
item.description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. AC 15+DEX (Max 2) Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

item.name: Ring Mail Armor
item.description: Leather with heavy rings swen into it. AC 14. Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

item.name: Chain Mail Armor
item.description: Made of interlocking metal rings worn over a layer of quilted fabric. Requires STR 13 to wear without penalty (reduce speed by 10ft). AC 16. Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

item.name: Splint Armor
item.description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints. Requires STR 15 to wear without penalty (reduce speed by 10ft). AC 17. Disadvantage on Stealth check.

item.name: Plate Armor
item.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body. AC 18. Requires STR 15. Disadvantage on Stealth checks.

item.name: Shield
item.description: Made from wood or metal and carried in one hand. Can only benefit from one shield at a time. AC +2.

item.name: Dagger
item.description: 1d4 piercing, 20/60 range, finesse, light, thrown

item.name: Handaxe
item.description: 1d6 slashing, 20/60 range, light, thrown

item.name: Javelin
item.description: 1d6 piercing, 30/120 range, thrown

item.name: Light Hammer
item.description: 1d4 bludgeoning, 20/60 range, thrown, light

item.name: Mace
item.description: 1d6 bludgeoning

item.name: Sickle
item.description: 1d4 slashing, light

item.name: Spear
item.description: 1d6 piercing, thrown, versatile (1d8)

item.name: Battleaxe
item.description: 1d8 slashing, versatile

item.name: Flail
item.description: 1d8 bludgeoning

item.name: Glaive
item.description: 1d10 slashing, heavy, reach, two-handed

item.name: Greataxe
item.description: 1d12 slashing, heavy, two-handed

item.name: Greatsword
item.description: 2d6 slashing, heavy, two-handed

item.name: Halberd
item.description: 1d10 slashing, heavy, two-handed

item.name: Lance
item.description: 1d12 piercing, reach, special: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you arenâ€™t mounted.

item.name: Longsword
item.description: 1d8 slashing, versatile

item.name: Maul
item.description: 2d6 bludgeoning, heavy, two-handed

item.name: Morningstar
item.description: 1d8 piercing

item.name: Pike
item.description: 1d10 piercing, heavy, reach, two-handed

item.name: Rapier
item.description: 1d8 piercing, finesse

item.name: Scimitar
item.description: 1d6 slashing, finesse, light

item.name: Shortsword
item.description: 1d6 piercing, finesse, light

item.name: Trident
item.description: 1d6 piercing, 20/60 range, thrown, versatile

item.name: War Pick
item.description: 1d8 piercing

item.name: Warhammer
item.description: 1d8 bludgeoning, versatile

item.name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
item.description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesnâ€™t need to make the save.

item.name: Bell
item.description: *Needs more cowbell.

item.name: Block and Tackle
item.description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

item.name: Chain (10 feet)
item.description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

item.name: Crowbar
item.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbarâ€™s leverage can be applied.

item.name: Grappling Hook
item.description: You can use a grappling hook to anchor a rope in place. Throwing a grappling hook successfully requires a Use Rope check (DC 10, +2 per 10 feet of distance thrown).

item.name: Hammer
item.description: The weighty metal sledge atop the wooden haft can easily break rock apart.

item.name: Hammer, Sledge
item.description: The weighty metal sledge atop the wooden haft can easily break rock apart.

item.name: Hunting Trap
item.description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

item.name: Lamp
item.description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

item.name: Lantern, Bullseye
item.description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

item.name: Lantern, Hooded
item.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

item.name: Lock
item.description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thievesâ€™ tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your GM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

item.name: Manacles
item.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thievesâ€™ tools can pick the manaclesâ€™ lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

item.name: Mirror, Steel
item.description: *Who's the most beautiful PC in the land?

item.name: Pick, Miner's
item.description: Good for breaking apart stone or hard-packed earth, a miner's pick can be used as an improvised weapon that deals piercing damage.

item.name: Piton
item.description: Climbers hammer pitons into walls to create their own handholds. Pitons are also useful for spiking a door shut, causing the door to become stuck.

item.name: Pot, Iron
item.description: Good for cooking, an iron pot can hold up to a gallon of fluid. It can also serve as an improvised weapon.

item.name: Spikes, Iron
item.description: *See Piton? Climbers hammer pitons into walls to create their own handholds. Pitons are also useful for spiking a door shut, causing the door to become stuck.

item.name: Whetstone
item.description: *During a short/long rest a fighter can whet a # of blades equal to his proficiency modifier. These blades, if in good condition, gain +1 damage on their next attack. If the blades are "broken" (i.e. in damaged condition but still repair-able), they are restored to working order. And aristocrats and knights might comment on the fine edge of the character's blades.

item.name: Carpenter's Tools
item.description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. The table shows examples of the most common types of tools, each providing items related to a single craft. Proficiency with a set of artisanâ€™s tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisanâ€™s tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Mason's Tools
item.description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. The table shows examples of the most common types of tools, each providing items related to a single craft. Proficiency with a set of artisanâ€™s tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisanâ€™s tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Smith's Tools
item.description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. The table shows examples of the most common types of tools, each providing items related to a single craft. Proficiency with a set of artisanâ€™s tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisanâ€™s tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Tinker's Tools
item.description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. The table shows examples of the most common types of tools, each providing items related to a single craft. Proficiency with a set of artisanâ€™s tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisanâ€™s tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Horn
item.description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.
